title: St Kilda Woolies sells on sub 6pc yield
text:
A Sydney-based investor paid about $8 million for a Woolworths Metro in Melbourne's St Kilda as neighbourhood shopping centre sales in Victoria climb toward a four-year high.

The small format 1574sq m supermarket at 64 Fitzroy Road on the ground floor of the Metropol apartment building developed by Andrew Rettig's R Corporation sold with a lease to Woolworths expiring in 2027.

Bringing in annual income of $467,000, it sold on a yield below 6 per cent.

The supermarket was put on the market six months ago by a local syndicate jointly owned by Brighton-based Bernard Edmondson and Alexander Turner.

The Woolworths store is on the St Kilda tramline.

Selling agents Stuart Taylor and Tom Noonan from JLL declined to comment on the metrics of the deal, citing a confidentiality agreement.
description: Smaller format Woolworths Metro supermarkets are proving popular with investors chasing yield and a strong leasing covenant.
